channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11983] HRegion constructors should not create HLog
item.description:
We should get rid of HRegion creating its own HLog. It should ALWAYS get the log from outside.
I think this was added for unit tests, but we should refrain from such practice in the future (adding UT constructors always leads to weird and critical bugs down the road). See recent: HBASE-11982, HBASE-11654.

Get rid of weird things like ignoreHLog:


  /**

   * @param ignoreHLog - true to skip generate new hlog if it is null, mostly for createTable

   */

  public static HRegion createHRegion(final HRegionInfo info, final Path rootDir,

                                      final Configuration conf,

                                      final HTableDescriptor hTableDescriptor,

                                      final HLog hlog,

                                      final boolean initialize, final boolean ignoreHLog)

We can unify all the createXX and newXX methods and separate creating a region in the file system vs opening a region.
item.summary: HRegion constructors should not create HLog

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Good by me. +1 putting stake in ground.
Sean Busbey any progress on this one?
I was hoping to do this after the refactoring in HBASE-10378, is there a pressing need to get it in sooner?
I noticed this is an issue causing our tests to leak file descriptors. I had some time for cleanup, but that time has passed. No specific hurry, just hygiene at this point.

Here's a refactor patch. HRegion now requires providing a WAL. HBaseTestingUtility has methods for creating a region and a wal for that region. The helper method for closing a region and it's wal is also moved to HBaseTestingUtility.
Reading over the description again, my patch is a subset of what's described. I'm hoping this will reduce our test suite leaking file handles though. More needs done to fixup the create vs open APIs.

I have a larger refactoring that does the full create / open change. I still have something like 6 test classes to finish refactoring. We could reduce the scope of this ticket for your current fix and then file a follow on with the rest from my stuff?
By all means, carry on with your larger undertaking. Sorry to pounce; I didn't know you were so close.
well, was close. Running numbers for HBASE-5699 has been a time sink.

Nick Dimiduk do you mind putting this to RB?

I rebased my patch, now seeing TestHRegion hang. Investigating.

Sean Busbey you still prefer to pursue your superset patch?
Rebased to trunk, fixed some failing tests. See what BuildBot has to say.
Enis Soztutar RB has been updated and I'm unable to create or attach files at present.
I'm happy to do my superset patch either here as a follow on jira. I probably won't have time to pick up again until the end of htis week.

Includes fixes for

  • TestOfflineMetaRebuildBase
  • TestReversibleScanners
  • TestAtomicOperation

Notably, this delta touches the offline meta repair functionality in HBCK.

Ugh. Finding my own checkstyle warnings is a needle-haystack problem. We need a checkstyle-results.xml diff utility. Cleaned up the obvious unused import culprits, let's see how it goes.

Yeah, I've wanted that for awhile and it's probably a better use of time than trying to handle bringing the number down in one fell swoop. filed HBASE-12850 against myself.

FWIW, I've done this manually before by looking at the check-patch util; it'll tell you which file to save and then diff.
